Description: Body sherd with handle root of black-glazed pottery large vessel; probably horizontal handle, hence a hydria or krater; inside reserved; exterior much worn but probably wholly glazed as far as preserved; incised inscription on outside.
Curator's comments: The juxtaposition of text and handle suggests that the text was lengthy.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 763, pl. XXI, no. 763)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 683, no. 414)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.772)
